snippet: Some provisions of the Affordable Care Act could reduce the use of medical services, but others could lead to a doctor shortage, by increasing demand and limiting payments, an economist writes.
abstract: Some provisions of the Affordable Care Act could reduce the use of medical services, but others could lead to a doctor shortage, by increasing demand and limiting payments, an economist writes.

headline.main: Conflicting Pressures on Demand for Doctors

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
